page.title: 19Ecology-The Beach cont'd
page.content: Moving creatures mostly consisted of crabs,including most often the common shore crab. The lower section was the most interesting because here we found many little rock pools amongst the mud.Especially interesting were the starfish of which we counted at least twenty and quite a number of brown shrimps.It is particularly difficult to move around this lower section of the beach because of the thick mud but if yo quick enough it is possible to find a number of different types of crab.We also dug in the mud to find lug worms they are a popular form of bait for the local fishermen.
